body:
Reported by est...@gmail.com, Jan 28, 2011
Make a better UI for the deck building option.

Is really cool that magarena allows you to make your own deck, but is really boring to change 1 card at time.

It is possible to make something like check boxes to say "I want to change all this cards" and then choose the one you wanna add.

Is also a pain to change the lands if you wanna to make a mono colored deck you have to make something like choose all the plains and change them one by one to swamps, can we add something like a text box or something to say "Change 4 of this lands to...."

Comment 1 by project member ubeefx, Jan 28, 2011
Do you know you can use a text editor to create decks yourself.
See how to do it on customizing Magarena page.

The one card at the time is mainly there for small tweaks to generated decks.

Adding a real deck builder is something that can be done, 
but until then the text editor is the way to go.
author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)
title: Deck building interface

comments.body:
Comment from David:
To build a deck using Magarena's UI is tedious. I think the biggest gripe I had was that I had to repeatedly filter cards because only one card can be selected from the filtered list. I gave up and ended up browsing cards and typing the names of those that I wanted on notepad.  I then opened an existing deck config (.dec file) using notepad (pure guess that .dec files are readable by text readers) to replace it with the cards I had chosen.

Also, if I remember correctly, the .dec format isn't automatically recognized by text readers. It was only through a guess that I realised text readers could open.dec files.  If a player didn't guess this, then he/she might find it a struggle to build a custom deck and be give up building one.

Implementing a search function could make browsing cards more convenient.
